  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA found Damaged HazMat on the Unload Rollers. Then took package to the QA Cage, no information regarding when this occurred, how this got damaged, where in the trailer it was damaged etc. DescribePack: 1 Container had a loose cap, all liquid was expelled from package and leaked all on the inside and outside of box. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: There was no communication regarding the mitigation

item.title: Report X-2023100885
item.description:
Report X-2023100885

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-05
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found package in front of van line 5 in a black tote. I moved it to the hazmat cage where I inspected the box and contents, the side was wet and torn at the bottom. One of the four bottles had a loose cap and leaked inside of the box. was damaged during preload. DescribePack: loose cap. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: bay doors and fans are open

item.title: Report X-2023100877
item.description:
Report X-2023100877

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-05
  • City: MISSOURI CITY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED ON PRELOAD. UPON INSPECTION THE PACKAGE CONTAINED 4 PLASTIC BOTTLES OF HYDROCHLORIC ACID WITH LOOSE CAPS. PACKAGE HANDLER MISHANDLED THE BOX AND THE PRODUCTS LEAKED AND WET ENTIRE BOX. UN1789 CORROSIVE LIQUID DescribePack: PLASTIC BOTTLE HAD LOOSE CAPS AND SPILLED AND WET ENTIRE BOX DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS CONTAINED IN A PLASTIC HAZARDOUS BAG AND TOTE AND BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AWAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH

item.title: Report X-2023100865
item.description:
Report X-2023100865

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: HEWITT
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the hazmat cage inside of a tote leaking from the bottom of the box. All of the cans are dented with 3 being severely dented/crushed causing one of the cans to start leaking from the bottom. It appears the cans were dropped causing the leakage. DescribePack: One can is leaking from the bottom. No cracks are holes can be seen. The can appears to be leaking from a seam. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside of a tote upright and then placed inside of the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023100708
item.description:
Report X-2023100708

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (28) 12 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE 3M FIRE BLOCK FOAM FB-FOAM. TWO INNER BOXES MARKED LIMITED QUANTITY WITH (12) 12 OUNCE CANS IN EACH BOX AND (4) LOOSE 12 OUNCE CANS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2023110119
item.description:
Report E-2023110119

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 26, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon container of UN3098 was punctured while in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the impacted site. ES&H personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN3098-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums. The damaged pail of product was placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2023100824

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DRUM WAS DROPPED OFF FROM UNLOAD WITH A SMALL HOLE AND SCRATCHES INDICTATING THAT DRUM WAS POSSIBLY DROPPED. AT TIME HAZMAT WAS PLACE INSIDE OF DRUM FOR SAFETY. DescribePack: TUGGER DRIVER FROM UNLOAD BROUGHT DRUM TO QA WITH SMALL HOLE STATED THAT IT CAME OFF THE TRUCK AND IT HAD SPILLED A LITTLE BIT. AT THIS TIME SMALL HOLE WAS VISUAL AND SCRATCHES. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE WAS WORN FOR PROTECTION AND HAZMAT WAS PLACED INSIDE OF DRUM AND PLACE INSIDE OF QA HAZMAT CAGE

item.title: Report X-2023100636
item.description:
Report X-2023100636

  • City: SAN ANTONIO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived with its caps loose on Gallons causing liquid content to spill out, Package was properly handled PPE Used Gloves, Splash Googles and apron, package was immediately placed inside the Hazmat cage and was put in a salvage drum to prevent further damage. DescribePack: Gallons arrived with loose caps not being properly tighten causing liquid contents to spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat package was placed inside the hazmat cage and put in a salvage drum to prevent further damage.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found on an unload trailer. leak was small and contained. package was moved to the hazmat cage for further inspection and processing. DescribePack: cap loose, no other damage found. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ap tightened and box kept in line with it orientation arrows.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Plastic jerrican was discovered leaking in trailer 56034 from 774-HOUS during unload around 7am. Isolated leaking container into a lined plastic drum. DescribePack: A puncture approx 6mm in the top of the plastic Jerrican allowed the liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Leaking Jerrican was isolated in a lined plastic drum upon discovery.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: ISP driver coded the package a 10 and left behind without notifying anyone. Upon inspection, it was found to be slightly damp, and one of the gallon containers looked about half full. DescribePack: After inspecting all the inner gallon containers, it was noticed that one of the caps was loose. No cracks or any other damage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was retaped.
